Participant.Name: Officer Joshua Burkitt
Detail: In the first link, there is one video showing an officer being carried away from the scene to where police vehicels parked; one video showing an officer being put on a police vehicle and driven away; one video showing an officer being treated in front of a police vehicle. There was another video showing another officer being carried on to a police vehicle but this video cannot be located anymore. Also, in the second link, in the dispatcher radio, it can be heard, dispatcher requesting "car stand by" instead of requesting for fire department/ambulance. At around 4:19, an officer can also be heard saying, "we will be transporting a shot officer." Later he said, "the injured officer has been transported to Temple. We are transporting another officer." Based on this, Prachi and I made the judge that these were police transport cases.

There was another video showing another officer being carried on to a police vehicle but this video cannot be located anymore. Also, in the second link, in the dispatcher radio, it can be heard, dispatcher requesting "car stand by" instead of requesting for fire department/ambulance. At around 4:19, an officer can also be heard saying, "we will be transporting a shot officer." Later he said, "the injured officer has been transported to Temple. We are transporting another officer." Based on this, Prachi and I made the judge that these were police transport cases.

Deputy Jaylon McEuen
Detail: A Golder Ranch firefighter who was at the scene told 13 News the suspect was shot in the leg and one deputy was shot in the back while another deputy was shot multiple times in the leg. My rationale here is that 1) if he was sent to the hospital by vehicle, firefighter would not know his injury in detail that soon; 2) if firefigher knows their injuries and there were multiple fire department vehicle on scene, I tend to believe that fire department transported them.
